intro: Oenothera laciniata var. typica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its showy, fragrant blooms. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
